title: The Content Pipeline
narration: Most teams present their content workflow as a clean five-stage pipeline. Brief, Creation, Review, Publish, Measure. This is the slide-deck version.

title: The Detailed Process
narration: Zoom in and each phase has multiple activities. Three steps in Brief alone. This is the process chart you would find in the team's operational documentation — structured, sequential, reassuring.

title: Where AI Agents Fit
narration: AI agents plug into specific steps. A Research Agent powers insights. A Content Writer drafts. An SEO Optimizer polishes for search. A Performance Analyst measures results. Four agents, each mapped to a phase.

title: The Real Complexity
narration: But this pipeline is a fiction. In reality, gates create checkpoints. Inputs ground decisions. Feedback loops send work back for revision. The neat columns dissolve into a living system.

title: What Agents Are Grounded In
narration: Agents do not operate in a vacuum. They draw on the Brand Voice Guide, Content Strategy, Audience Personas, Analytics Data, and SEO Tools. This reference layer is what makes agent output consistent and contextualized rather than generic.

title: Human-in-the-Loop Gates
narration: Gates are the critical checkpoints. Brief Approval, Quality Check, Brand Review, Stakeholder Sign-off, and Performance Review. Each gate has criteria for auto-pass and clear escalation triggers. This is where human judgment stays in the loop.

title: When Work Escalates
narration: When a gate fails, work flows back for revision or escalates to a higher authority. A brand score below threshold sends content back to compliance. Performance failure can trigger a full re-brief. These feedback loops are what makes the system self-correcting.

title: Explore the Full Picture
narration: This is the complete content production graph. Steps, gates, agents, and inputs, all connected by clear data flows and escalation paths. Click any node to explore its connections. This is what it means to design AI into a workflow, not bolt it on.

title: Your Role in the Future
narration: As AI agents take on more production work, human roles do not disappear — they shift. The steps you own today become the judgment calls that agents cannot make. Every human-owned or shared step in this graph is a point where your expertise, creativity, or authority is irreplaceable.

title: How Your Team Supports the Vision
narration: No role works alone. The Content Director's brief feeds the Editor's review. The Brand Manager's escalation reaches the VP. The Analytics Lead's performance data loops back to a new brief. Gates are where roles meet — the human collaboration layer that holds the system together.
